Description: Limestone ostracon. 12 lines of text on recto and 5 lines on verso containing a financial document.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Monastery of St Phoibammon, Location of the Temple of Mentuhotep I.
Bibliographic references: Biedenkopf-Ziehner 2000a / Koptische Ostraka I: Ostraka aus dem Britischen Museum in London (133-137, pl.11)
Delattre 2002 / CR de O.Brit.Mus.Copt. II et O.Ashm.Copt. (p.331-32)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82876) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82876)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Job (son of Petros)
Named in inscription: Pesynthios (son of Sebetios)
Named in inscription: Joseph (son of Johannes)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. II 10 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
